DocumentFragment.summary: The DocumentFragment interface represents a minimal document object that has no parent.

remarks.para: It is used as a lightweight version of that stores a segment of a document structure comprised of nodes just like a standard document. The key difference is due to the fact that the document fragment isn't part of the active document tree structure. Changes made to the fragment don't affect the document.

DocumentFragmentAppend.summary:
The DocumentFragment.append() method
inserts a set of objects or strings after
the last child of the document fragment. Strings
are inserted as equivalent nodes.

remarks.para: This method appends a child to a DocumentFragment. To append to an arbitrary element in the tree, see .

DocumentFragmentChildElementCount.summary:
The DocumentFragment.childElementCount read-only property
returns the number of child elements of a DocumentFragment.

remarks.para: To get the number of children of a specific element, see .

DocumentFragmentChildElementCount.value: A number representing the number of children of the document fragment.

DocumentFragmentChildren.summary:
The read-only children property returns a live
which contains all of the child of the document fragment upon which it was called.
DocumentFragmentChildren.value:
An which is a live, ordered collection of the DOM
elements which are children of the document fragment. You can access the
individual child nodes in the collection by using either the
method on the collection, or by using
JavaScript array-style notation.If the document fragment has no element children, then children is an empty list with a
length of 0.

DocumentFragmentDocumentFragment.summary:
The DocumentFragment() constructor returns a new, empty
object.

DocumentFragmentFirstElementChild.summary:
The DocumentFragment.firstElementChild read-only property
returns the document fragment's first child , or null if there
are no child elements.
DocumentFragmentFirstElementChild.value: An that is the first child Element of the object, or null if there are none.

DocumentFragmentGetElementById.summary: The getElementById() method of the returns an object representing the element whose property matches the specified string. Since element IDs are required to be unique if specified, they're a useful way to get access to a specific element quickly.

remarks.para: If you need to get access to an element which doesn't have an ID, you can use to find the element using any {{Glossary("CSS selector", "selector")}}.

blockquote.para: IDs should be unique inside a document fragment. If two or more elements in a document fragment have the same ID, this method returns the first element found.

DocumentFragmentGetElementById.returns: An object describing the DOM element object matching the specified ID, or null if no matching element was found in the document fragment.

DocumentFragmentLastElementChild.summary:
The DocumentFragment.lastElementChild read-only property
returns the document fragment's last child , or null if there
are no child elements.
DocumentFragmentLastElementChild.value: An that is the last child Element of the object, or null if there are none.

DocumentFragmentMoveBefore.summary: NOTE Experimental The moveBefore() method of the interface moves a given inside the invoking DocumentFragment as a direct child, before a given reference node.

DocumentFragmentPrepend.summary:
The DocumentFragment.prepend() method
inserts a set of objects or strings before
the first child of the document fragment. Strings
are inserted as equivalent nodes.

remarks.para: This method prepends a child to a DocumentFragment. To prepend to an arbitrary element in the tree, see .

DocumentFragmentQuerySelector.summary:
The DocumentFragment.querySelector() method returns the
first element, or null if no matches are found, within the
(using depth-first pre-order traversal of the
document's nodes) that matches the specified group of selectors.

remarks.para:
If the selector matches an ID and this ID is erroneously used several times in the
document, it returns the first matching element.

If the selectors specified in parameter are invalid a with
a SYNTAX_ERR value is raised.

DocumentFragmentQuerySelector.returns:
An object representing the first element in the document
that matches the specified set of CSS selectors, or null is returned if there are no matches.

DocumentFragmentQuerySelectorAll.summary:
The DocumentFragment.querySelectorAll() method returns a
of elements within the (using
depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that matches the specified
group of selectors.

remarks.para:
If the selectors specified in parameter are invalid a with
a SYNTAX_ERR value is raised.

DocumentFragmentQuerySelectorAll.returns:
A non-live containing one object for
each element that matches at least one of the specified selectors or an empty
in case of no matches.

DocumentFragmentReplaceChildren.summary:
The DocumentFragment.replaceChildren() method replaces the
existing children of a DocumentFragment with a specified new set of children. These
can be string or objects.
